Introduction

Reflection 1: Couting with our body
There are more musical instruments in Figure 1 than we have fingers in our hands. How can we count these instruments?

Together we are capable

When we cannot count alone, we can ask for help. Like this, we are able to count:
First personSecond personThird personFourth person
To count with other people solve again our issues. But, take a look on Figure 2 taken in Copán, Honduras, that have the biggest text known in the Maya region:
Figure 2: Altar, stele, and the largest hieroglyphic text at the Copan site (Instituto Hondureño de Antropologia e Historia, ). Photo taken on during a visit to the site.
This hieroglific text, present in the background of the image, need various people to count everything. Let us think in another solution:

?
Reflection 2: Thinking together
Take a look on your fingers, could you find antoher way to count?

Another solution

The necessity to count did not appear nowadays. It exists since a long time ago, when there were not cities or houses built. We know this thanks scientits that discovered bones with marks in different places (González Redondo, Francisco A., et al., , pp. 174 - 177, 180 - 182 ; Puente, Francico Barriga, , pp. 21 - 23):

Figure 1: Representation of baboon bone adorned with markings. This image, credited to Enrique Silván Pobes, is featured in the scholarly work of Francisco A. Gonzáles Redondo et al.
The original is available in ResearchNet (González Redondo, Francisco A., et al., ), and its inclusion here is made possible by the authorization of Doctor Francisco A. Gonzales Redondo.

Over the centuries, various numeration systems have been utilized, some of which endure to this day. In the following sections, we present an overview of contemporary systems alongside those that have recently fallen out of use.
Observe the marks on bones look like our fingers raised.

Conclusion

On this text, we learnt that with help of other people we can count even more, but we also observed that this does not fix all issues.
We also learnt that after to use fingers to count, the next step was to do marks. This was not the unique answer found. In the next texts, we are going to explore more options created to do couting.
